titleStmt.title: Here begynneth the seynge of urynes, of all the colours that uryns be of with medycynes annexed to euery uryne, [and] euery uryne his urynall, not imprynted in englysshe before this tyme, moche profytable for euery man to knowe.
Seynge of uryns.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprynted by [J. Rastell for] me Rycharde Banckes dwellynge in London in the Pultry, a lytell fro ye stockes, at the lo[n]ge shoppe by saynt Myldredes churche dore,
publicationStmt.date: The. xxvii. day of May, the yere of our lord M.CCCCC. and. xxv. [1525]]

notesStmt.note: Leaf C4 has two paragraphs on pregnancy omitted in other editions.
At foot of title: Cu[m] gratia et priuilegio a rege indulto.
Imprint from colophon; actual printer's name from STC.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: London in the Pultry, a lytell fro ye stockes, at the lo[n]ge shoppe
